intro: Echinocactus lemairei, commonly known as the Lemaire’s cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is a columnar cactus characterized by its ribbed, cylindrical stem and sparse, spiny foliage. The plant produces yellow flowers during the summer months, which bloom at the ends of its stems. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil. Due to its slow growth and ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and collections.
